title: Arrests May Drop but Minor Crimes Are Not Dropping
text:
Regarding “Arrests Drop Sharply for Minor Crimes” (U.S. News, Oct. 7): Certainly this must be good news we can applaud. But let’s mute the applause button for a moment and look at the flip side.

We live in a village adjacent to San Francisco, a small community with a vigilant and vigorous police force. Recently, my son’s car was broken into on the street outside our house and his backpack stolen with school computer, etc., a previously unknown crime hereabout. Our local police took a report but said it was “for insurance...
description: Commit a “minor crime” and nothing happens to you. Don’t ask law-abiding people how we feel about this new and improved approach to criminal behavior.
